text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to try to formulate with U.S. President Clinton a formula for resumption of talks with Syria.
- Inquiry commission to investigate fire brigade's handling Friday's Jerusalem forest fire.
- Thirty-five "Russian mafia" chiefs will be expelled from Israel.
- Government to sell 70 companies and banks for 18 million shekels within four years, according to still incomplete privatisation programme being formulated by prime minister's office.
- Defence Minister Mordechai and Palestinian leader Arafat will try today to set a date for their meeting.
- 18,000 more permits to be issued for Palestinian workers.
- Fire devastates forests, property in Jerusalem corridor area.
